headline: 90-Second Keto Bread in a Mug
description: Try keto bread is microwaved quickly and easily with only 5 ingredients in 90 seconds! This bread is so tasty and perfect for sandwiches and toast.

video.description: This keto bread is easy and comes together in the microwave in 90 seconds!
video.name: 90 Second Keto Bread in a Mug

name: 90-Second Keto Bread in a Mug

recipeInstructions.text: Microwave butter in a microwave-safe mug until melted, about 15 seconds. Swirl the mug to coat with butter.
Add almond flour, egg, baking powder, and salt to the mug; whisk until smooth.
Microwave on high until set, about 90 seconds. Let cool for 2 minutes before slicing.

review.reviewBody: GREAT RECIPE! Everyone complaining about egg flavor, just omit the yolk. Simple fix!
I have another recipe for this bread where it calls for far less almond flour and the taste was definitely eggy. I like this much better!

Pleasantly surprised at taste and texture. Super quick and easy to make. I followed the recipe and it turned out exactly as shown. Just starting out on keto and this will definitely make things a whole lot easier! Highly recommend :)

My son sent me this recipe. It's super fast and easy. I sliced mine (after two minutes of cooling) and had a ham sandwich. Next time I'mma try cinnamon and blueberries and stevia sweetener. Like my son said, it's a game changer when you're low carbing.
Left out the butter and turned out perfectly.
Holy moly, life changer. I subbed gf flour and vegan butter. Perfect.

For an even healthier version skip the butter and use olive oil, skip the whole egg and use egg whites from your dairy section and skip the salt altogether. You can always doctor the flavor by adding a little low fat flavored dairy creamer to the mix. The final consistency and end product still looks like that shown.
Very easy, the best substitute for bread I have found eating healthy Keto. Tastes a little eggy, but I expected that. VERY good toasted with cinnamon Swerve! Keto Cinnamon Toast!
I Love this& it so good !!!
Easy, fast, and tasty
Fantastic!!! So easy and delicious. I added rosemary and Italian seasoning. My son is very impressed and this is now my go-to bread. Thank you.

I tried making it twice just in case the first time I did not whisk the ingredients enough. It looked the way it does in the pictures but the taste was awful to me. Not so much bothered by the egg but I think the almond flour did not taste good to me at all. They also felt heavy in my stomach. I did try them with buttered with some peanut butter but nope. Giving away my almond flour and baking powder.
Made exactly as written. Strong egg flavor, but moist. Great texture. Will try this one more time but following the recipe one of the other reviewers wrote.
So easy and really tasty.
I liked it, but I think I added too much salt. It tasted really salty' Texture is good, I will make it again, just leave out the salt.
I love the texture! The flavor was a little bland so I will be experimenting by adding different spices. It is definitely a great substitute for bread. Kind of reminded me of an English muffin.

I don't have a microwave, but used an airfryer. Needed to cook about 9 min as when I first tried it the bottom was not done. Also, i used Earth Balance buttery spread. Will use real butter next time. It's not real bread, but is a decent quick substitute. Will definitely make again.

Very quick and easy to make. It comes out easily and is nice and fluffy. I've made it twice now and have started playing with the receipe. It is easy to add cinnamon and a little Swerve to make it somewhat sweeter if desired. I will definitely be using this recipe more often.
This is the perfect replacement for an English muffin when the rest of the fam is doing eggs benedict--really quick and diabetic friendly...thanks so much for sharing
No changes; will try variations, both sweet and savory.
It’s pretty good.

I know what you're thinking, microwaved low carb bread? I, too, had low expectations, but it was so easy it was worth a shot. Well, I made it. It turned out better than expected! It has a moist cake like consistency. Good with butter. Very high protein and filling. For something that only takes 90 seconds in the microwave it's very good!

Great! Didn’t have almond flour but it worked with coconut flour . I had to add a bit of water. 
I toasted in air fryer and topped with mashed avocado! Mad great avocado toast!
Awesome and as easy as any recipe could get!
Just popped it out of the mug. I added garlic/onion powder Italian seasoning ...looks good and smells good next time I have a few min. I will do the same but add parm which I forgot on round 1
It’s good! Also good as a base to which you can add cheese, herbs, etc.
Love this recipe! Finally, guilt free bread! I’m gluten free, but gluten free breads are really high in carbs…. This one is gluten free and low carb! Awesome!
I sliced into 4 pieces and scooped my Scrambled Eggs (Gordon Ramsey Style) onto the slices. It took away that craving for bread instantly and it tastes good too!

I made this for breakfast today and enjoyed it. I am trying to stay away from bread so this is just right. I could taste the egg but I used a jumbo egg. Didn't change anything except using "smart balance" instead of butter. I toasted it and put a smidge of peanut butter on it. Next time I'll add more salt and whip it longer. Looking forward to making this again.
Tastes like a egg with grains in it. I had with grape jelly for breakfast. Not large enough t slice for a sandwich. Maybe for finger sandwiches at a tea.
I loved the ease of this recipe. The bread is awesome, finally bread on Keto!!!

I am quite pleased with the result of this recipie. Super simple and very versatile. For garlic bread add a bit of minced or garlic powder. Add some pizza spice for another go at it. Add some left over sautéed peppers and bacon for another choice. I make mine in a glass dish that is about the same circumference as a muffin. It puffs up quite high so I am able to cut it into 4 rounds to make 2 muffin style sandwiches. I pop them into the toaster or pan fry, then add toppings - pizza flavour, ham’n cheese, cheese and sausage, etc. Super quick, super convent and super satisfying. Tons of personalization choices too. Going to try making burger sliders next.
This is so good!! And simple to make.
I used flaxseed meal by mistake today and the bread got even fluffier and more moist…plus flaxseed is way cheaper than almond flour

This stuff is great! I cut it in to 4 pieces, pop those suckers in the toaster for a few minutes and have delicious low carb "English muffins"! They definitely do the trick when I'm craving some bread. An additional plus is they are SO quick to whip up if I'm in a hurry.

I loved this it tastes just like bread. Yesterday, was my first day on keto and I came across this recipe and I had a breakfast sandwich with it before I went to school. It was so good I decided to make a whole loaf it works I took a long plastic tupperware (about the size of a loaf pan). For anyone who wants to try this, I did 1/2 cup of Almond flour, 2 eggs, 1 teaspoon, and a heaping pinch of salt. It is so good I plan on making a blueberry lemon loaf and a jalapeno popper loaf.
Quick. Easy. Toasted slice in buttered frying pan. Tasty.
I think I need to adjust my % of heat or else time, but it worked and tastes wonderful.
My hubby and I are at the end of 3 weeks strict keto still a long way to go but we absolutely loved splitting a grilled cheese this evening!! Awesome recipe xo
excellent substitute when missing bread on Keto. I added a drop of vanilla and cooked in my microwave for 110 seconds. Texture is between cornbread and cake, but flavor is great -

Okay - I was skeptical, but this is pretty darn good. The amount of calories is high, so cutting it into three even slices helps that part. Great with cream cheese or peanut butter spread on it! And great toasted. I can't stand the purchased Keto bread and this really fills that craving for bread on this diet!

I am not on a keto diet, but I decided to try this because it is gluten-free and seemed easy! It was really good! Now I know what I will make for lunch when we are out of bread! It was very light and fluffy like a sponge, but don’t worry. It tastes sooooo much better than a sponge. I added a tsp of vanilla extract and a pinch of cinnamon and it was perfect. Instead of melting butter to coat the sides, I just sprayed the mug with cooking spray. 90 seconds was perfect.

Everything I make from Allrecipes is amazing and this did not disappoint! Thank you for the game changer recipe in my quest for a good GF bread to compliment a meal!! Literally overjoyed at how good this turned out! A million thank yous!!!

This is easy to make and delicious! I had some left over. 
I’ll make this again!

I'll start out by saying I am not on a keto diet and was simply looking for an easy mug bread. I simply used regular flour (in place of almond). I also used coconut oil because I was curious what it would taste like. I love it! I don't eat a lot of bread so I don't buy it for myself. This is perfect for when I do actually want to make a sandwich! Great base recipe that you can do anything with! I will be playing around with some of the suggestions based on other reviews!
Not bad when you are really missing bread...a bit eggy though.
These were so scrumptious. I added 1/2 cup of chopped walnuts because...well, I love nuts! The cookies were more of a bread consistency, but very yummy!

I made this recipe exactly as directed and it turned out fantastic! I had to heat my butter twice as long and could probably have made it with half as much butter but 90 seconds was the exact time it needed to cook. I took it out of the mug and waited to slice it and it is crumbly like cornmeal but has a great flavor. To me the groans reminded me of nuts in multigrain bread.
I look forward to fiddling with it to try different varieties like others have done.
If you decide to make this, FOLLOW THE RECIPE EXACTLY before messing with it so you know how to adjust it as necessary. if you don't like it grainy, then try sifting it before cooking it.
Awesome!

I'm kind of new on low carb diet, and have been buying store bought low carb breads - but they are expensive and high in sodium. This was great! Couldn't be easier! I only had almond meal & not almond flour but it still worked and was like a dense multigrain bread. I sliced it in four and got two servings. Thank you!!!

Wonderful recipes: one addition, one note.. 
1. I can’t afford to use “good butter” all the time so I keep a package of the good stuff and then the cheaper stuff around too.. you’re going to want to pull out the good stuff for this one. 
2. Put Parmesan cheese in this. It gets a little chewy and just adds EVERYTHING to this recipe! I used maybe 1&1/2 to 2 tablespoons. Mix it in with all the ingredients before cooking.

First time I made it kind of tasted like cornbread because I had to use sour milk and baking soda as I was out of baking powder. Second time I made it with baking powder and it was a cross between a roll and a biscuit. Very good with butter on top.

For sweeter version I added 1 tablespoon heavy cream, 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract. 1/2 tablespoon sugar blend spends them swirled blueberry sauce. After I sliced and added more butter and brown sugar swerve on top and soaked in heavy cream and then pan seared over butter. Comes out like French toast!! So delicious!! Next time I will added real blueberry to batter and maybe pecans!

Yes!! One small variation: a splash of white vinegar. It takes away any eggy aftertaste and combined with the baking powder it gives the bread extra fluff. Perfect otherwise as is. The possibilities are endless.

I really loved this! I followed the directions exactly and got a great result. There is an understandably eggy taste. Some people may like it but it's not for me. Next time I will add a pinch of nutmeg to cut through that taste. I will definitely make this again, because it really is the best Keto bread that I've tried.
Loved the nutty taste and just put butter on it. Will experiment with herbs .

OMG I love to dip bread in olive oil with a glass of wine, this was great and fast!
Thanks

Wow. Best bread substitute I’ve come across. You still won’t mistake it for bread but it has a pleasant chewy texture and great structural integrity so it can be sliced and toasted like bread. Thanks for posting
Worked well. I cut into three pieces and served with cream cheese and "everything but the bagel" seasoning. Got me over my bagel craving.

If you’re trying to watch your carbs and want a bread that’s muffinesque, super fast, and super easy, this is the bread for you. It comes out for us every time and is delicious. Well worth five stars. 

We aren’t keto, so we sub the butter with smart balance. We cook it in a flat bottom fairly standard sized cereal bowl (makes a little over 3 inch diameter disc), slice it in half, toast it in a pan, and layer a turkey sausage patty, greens, and a fried egg or egg whites in between for breakfast.

I made it today and it really wasnt bad, kinda bland but I may want to add like egg, and tomatoes on it and try that. 

Everyone have a Blessed day.

First time making any kind of "keto" pastry and I enjoyed it. I added some Italian seasoning to it as well as a packet of monk fruit sweetener and it was delicious! Will definitely be making again. I made a grilled cheese sandwich using provolone cheese and deli sliced ham.

Was hoping for a grain-free “bread” that I could make for my diabetic sister who is trying to limit her grain carbs, but is weary of bunless burgers. Made the recipe exactly as written. Turned out as well as advertised! Really looking forward to experimenting with flavors, additions, toasting/pan frying for different applications. Thank you for this recipe!
Kinda dry but I used coconut flour-I’ll need to buy more almond flour! Tastes pretty good though...& easy peasy!
Makes 4 nice Little slices. I’m trying it as toast next.

I am thrilled to have this recipe. It is so fast and easy to make. I also put it in a square bottom dish to bake so it come out like a pizza crust and I also use for french toast and bread crumbs for breading chicken

Pleasantly surprised by this recipe and so easy, has the texture of bread, once you toast it anyway, I didn't try it before I toasted it. I will definitely make again, may add some dill or other seasonings for more flavor. Wondering if you could add lemon extract and sweetener for more of a cake like bread?

Thank you very much for this recipe. I'm on my 6th week of a keto diet and been craving for a sandwich like crazy. I followed the recipe exactly as is, only added a pinch of oregano and a packet of Splenda to break the eggy taste. Loved it!

I was afraid it would taste eggy and over-powering of almond flavor, but surprisingly it did not. I like to toast mine up on the stovetop in a skillet and the texture is spot on for toast. It’s a great vehicle for yummy toppings, like avocados and tomatoes and cheese. Winner, winner, chicken dinner!

Delicious! I made as written first time, pretty good but kinda boring. Not too eggy, though, so I was ready to experiment. I added 1 tsp pesto and ~1/4 cup shredded Parmesan cheese, plus 1 Tbsp coconut flour in place of 1 Tbsp almond flour. It was SO GOOD -- I can't wait to make it again! Thanks for a perfect base recipe for keto bread.

I've been making this recipe regularly since I found it several months ago. It is my go to bread recipe. Used it to make avocado toast this morning. Added a little Vidalia onion, sea salt, and a few sunflower seeds to the avocado mash. Topped it all off with some campari tomato slices and splash of balsamic vinegar. It was amazing. This is a versatile recipe that can be used in many ways. I like to add a half to one teaspoon of psyllium husk fiber for great texture. You could also use golden flax meal for texture. For grilled sandwiches and hamburger buns, I use a ramekin to make these and then cut it in half. It really is a no fail recipe that works for me every time. Thank you so much for sharing it!
Surprised how good it came out with just these ingredients. Would be really good toasted with butter. Will be making again!

It has the texture of corn bread. I highly recommend toasting it. It is dry when eaten with just butter. I have sugar free strawberry jam and it was perfection!I can't wait to use this to make a sandwich!
I added 1 minced jalapeño & 1/3 cup grated Cheddar. Yummy!
Really good!
really good! Used it for avocado toast. TWEAK: Instead of using a whole egg, I used 3 tbsps of liquid egg white and just under a tbsp of ground flaxseed. Toasted it and done.

This is actually a pretty good bread substitute. Yea it does have an egg flavor and after sitting for a little bit it does get dry, but when you add meat or cheese to make a sandwich it works perfectly. I like to mix in everything bagel seasoning before I microwave it. When it's done i slice it into 4 slices and top them with lox and cream cheese.

Read many reviews but I was still a skeptic! New to keto. This is a great basic recipe that can be tweaked. Love the other suggestions. Definitely satisfies and super easy. I added a pinch of garlic powder to my first two batches. I can get 4 slices out of one batch with the bowl I use. Yummy ??
I added stevia to give it some taste and no salt the 2nd time I made it.

It was so quick and satisfying. It holds together well and the texture is very bread like, not crumbly. It needed some more butter on top or jam, but that's easy to do. Oh, I calculated the calories and came up with 281 total, not 408. I like that better.

Turns out pretty dang eggy, but not bad when I’m in a pinch and don’t have bread. A nice base too, for making other kinds of breads with it, like adding a little cinnamon and sugar or banana and/or chocolate chips or some savory herbs. I’m not on a keto diet, just gf because I have celiac disease, so I don’t strictly follow keto. I just see a lot of keto options in my feed for gf.
I love this recipe! It's so quick to make. I do add everything bagel seasoning sometimes. Perfect!

When I found this recipe today, I did make it twice. The first mug was so dry that my husband named it the choking bread, because it got caught in both of our throats.
So, I tried it again adding some half and half, and some Italian herbs. This was much better, but still too dry. I will make it again with more liquid. I love how quick and easy it is to make, and I did miss having bread in my life.
This is the greatest pre -workout breakfast.
I make grilled cheese with it!

When you are missing having bread on a Ketogenic diet, this comes to the rescue. I found that I could get three pretty good slices out of one recipe. Goes well with a platter of scrambled eggs too. My wife also liked it. And that was a surprise bonus.
It was amazing!!! Quick and easy.
fluffy! Delish cut in half topped with fried eggs. Yum!
toasted it in butter in the skillet. Worked great. The speed from no bread to bread is awesome

This was fast and delicious! After it was done it slid right out of the cup. I sliced it and panfried it on both sides with butter. I topped it with cream cheese and everything bagel seasoning and one with peanut butter and strawberry jelly. I can make it without bagels now!
Thanks it can delicious and I’ll be making it for now on
I made this exactly as written and it turned out great! I definitely will make it again! Keto recipes are not usually this easy. Tastes great also, with a nice bread-like texture.

I’ve made this multiple times, but almost never follow the recipe exactly. I will keep experimenting. Most often I add frozen blueberries and really like it for breakfast. This morning I tried adding peanut butter powder along with some blueberries. It turned out more like a cake - tasted great, but no way I could have sliced it and used it like bread. Use your imagination and enjoy!
Very easy and quick. Very tasty.
Very good and simple to make.
Made it with 3/4 teas of baking powder and no salt. It made 4 one inch slices. Don't go over 90 secs or the bottom slice will be hard.

Great quick recipe. First time I made it as described, English muffin or crumpet style. Second time I added a bit of flax and garlic, whipped the egg white and folded in, and cooked in a glass rectangular dish. Cut in half it made two great hotdog buns.
Yum!
It was quick and tasty. Thank you.
